meanings.definition: To fill or take up (space, time, etc.)
meanings.sent1: The large sofa occupies most of the living room.
meanings.sent2: The book occupies the top shelf in the library.
meanings.sent3: The busy ants occupy the picnic area, looking for crumbs.
meanings.sent4: Laughter occupies the room, making everyone smile.
meanings.sent5: The colorful painting occupies the wall, brightening the space.

meanings.definition: To reside or live in (a place)
meanings.sent1: The family occupies the cozy cabin during the summer.
meanings.sent2: Birds occupy the trees in the park.
meanings.sent3: The friendly ghost claims to occupy the old mansion.
meanings.sent4: Joy occupies the hearts of those who live in harmony.
meanings.sent5: Peace occupies the small town, creating a serene atmosphere.

meanings.definition: To hold or possess (a position, job, etc.)
meanings.sent1: She occupies the role of team captain with pride.
meanings.sent2: The CEO occupies a corner office on the top floor.
meanings.sent3: The cat pretends to occupy the throne, acting regal.
meanings.sent4: Hope occupies the minds of those who dream big.
meanings.sent5: Determination occupies his thoughts, driving him towards success.
